timeline.author: KevinGilmore

timeline.bodyText: When we move the code to the other module, we should also put all the tests in the same package as the Plane class.
timeline.author: KevinGilmore

timeline.bodyText: When naming the tests, keep in mind what the different parts of the name mean. The "given" is for preconditions or saying what the input is. The "when" is for describing the behavior being tested. The "then" is to describe the expected result. Thus, an appropriate name for this method would be givenSameContents_whenDeepEquals_thenTrue. Rename the other tests according to this pattern as well.
timeline.author: KevinGilmore

timeline.bodyText: Just use a single call: assertTrue(Arrays.deepEquals(planes1, planes2)
timeline.author: KevinGilmore

timeline.bodyText: Again, no need to create a variable -- put the expression in the assertion
timeline.author: KevinGilmore
KevinGilmore
KevinGilmore
KevinGilmore

timeline.message:
Revert "[BAEL-4281] Examples of array comparisons"

This reverts commit fefd7172a2ddff3356a6c37c1bb38b4ebc31374a.
[BAEL-4281] Naming convention and conversion to assertJ
